page.title: 05ECOLOGY IN BRAMSHAW (CONT)
page.content: {NATURAL HISTORY.}The area abounds with wild life. New Forest ponies are an established breed. Deer, of which fallow is the most plentiful, also sika, roe & red deer. Deer are culled by the FC to prevent overstocking. Other animals include badger, fox, hare, grey squirrel & sundry small rodents. There are 3 kinds of snakes, adder,being the only poisonous snake in Britain, grass snake & the rare smooth snake. There are trout & eels in the streams also newts & frogs. An abundance of flora & a wide variety of birds, butterflies & moths which flourish in the deciduous & conifer woodlands, moorland & bog. Insectivorous plants eg. sundew & butterwort are found in bogs. The main deciduous trees are oak, beech, sweet chestnut, alder, birch and holly. Conifers are planted & sold by FC.
